Now, a \u2018shelter\u2019 for wayward c.description: AHMEDABAD: They say, necessity is the mother of invention. Increasing incidents of crocodile attacks and straying into human settlements have forced the forest department to ‘detain’ them in Pavagadh and scout for tourism potential as well. According to chief conservator of forests (CCF), Vadodara division, S K Shrivastav, it has been decided that stray reptiles will now be bundled off to a unique ‘Kala Pani’ carved out of an abandoned quarry of blacktrap in the Dhobi Ghat area. “It will be spread over one hectare. The place is 54km from Vadodara city,” he said. The step may bring respite to those in Vadodara city and villages along the Charotar belt who usually see these reptiles lurking in water bodies in their vicinity. Today, there are close to 250 crocodiles in Charotar belt and 300 in Vadodara city. The work on creating the unique habitat has already begun and it will be ready in two months. “The area will house more than 100 crocodiles,” said Shrivastav. “The forest department usually releases the rescued crocodiles. Now, they will be released in this zone. There are 37 such abandoned mines that can be exploited for similar purposes,” said deputy conservator of forests Anshuman Sharma. What has prompted the move is the gradual increase in incidents of human-reptile conflicts. In Vadodara, citizens may have made peace with these jawed reptiles, but Vishwamitri river has witnessed crocodile attacks at Sama lake and Asoj lake where five lives were lost in 2014. In 2017, two injuries were reported in Vishwamitri river, while in the following year, three injuries were recorded there. “People in the Charotar belt have learnt to live with crocodiles, which is not the case in Vadodara city,” said former Wildlife Institute of India (WII) member B C Choudhry. The growing attacks are also being reasoned to the growing number of crocodile population. These reptiles are highly territorial, making them more prone to attacks. The 2015 census had revealed presence of over 260 crocodiles in the 25km stretch of Vishwamitri river that passes through the heart of Vadodara. In the Anand-Charotar belt, 58 crocodiles were sighted at Deva village in Anand district. After Deva, the maximum number of crocodiles (38) were sighted in the two water bodies of Heranj, followed by 28 and 25 in Traj and Dabhou villages. Parking tiff leads to stone pelting in K.description: VADODARA: The communally sensitive area of Panigate witnessed tense moments on Sunday afternoon after mobs belonging to different communities resorted to stone pelting. One person suffered injuries in the clashes that ensued after heated arguments occurred between two persons in Kumbharwada. Panigate police have booked and detained nine persons from both sides. According to the police, the incident occurred when Akash Sharma, a resident of Panigate, entered into a verbal argument with Sajid alias Batako Dewan over parking issue. Soon the argument turned physical and Dewan allegedly hit Akash with a baseball bat. “Within few minutes, mobs from both communities came on the roads and resorted to stone pelting. We rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control,” said Megha Tewar, ACP. The cops dispersed the mobs and soon conducted combing operations in the area. “One person who suffered injuries has been admitted to a hospital. We have detained nine persons from both sides. We are verifying their identity and some of them may be minors,” Tewar said. Security has been upped in the area after the skirmish with cops out on foot patrol. Vadodara: Seven die cleaning septic tank.description: VADODARA: Seven persons died of asphyxiation inside a septic tank at a hotel in Fartikui village of Dabhoi taluka in Vadodara on Friday midnight. Uncertainty loomed large over their kin as most of the deceased were sole breadwinners for their families. The incident took place at Hotel Darshan on Dabhoi-Vadodara state highway between 12 midnight and 12.30 am. One of the workers had entered the tank for cleaning it but fell unconscious. T he remaining workers went inside one after the other to save the others, but all of them ended up suffocating to death.  Vadodara Fire and Emergency Services uses an earthmover to widen the mouth of the tank to recover the bodiesThe hotel owner, Hassan Abbas Bhoraniya, was booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder and violation of Prohibition of Employment as Manual Scavengers and their Rehabilitation Act and Scheduled Castes and Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act. He is absconding, said police. Meanwhile, the Gujarat government announced a financial assistance of Rs 4 lakh each to the kin of all the deceased. In a statement, Chief Minister Vijay Rupani said that he has directed the police to take strict action against the hotel owner. Workers died of suffocation due to high gas pressureThe seven deceased include Ashok Harijan (45), his son Hitesh Harijan (23), Mahesh Harijan (25), Mahesh Patanwadiya (47), Vijay Chaudhary (22), Sahdev Vasava (22) and Ajay Vasava (22). While Ashok, his son Hitesh, Patanwadiya and Mahesh Harijan were called for cleaning the septic tank, Chaudhary, Sahdev and Ajay were housekeeping employees at the hotel and were assisting them. Ashok was the first to enter the tank and had removed some of the dirty water using a bucket. But when the rope tied to bucket broke, he went further inside the tank to bring out the bucket. After going a little deep, Ashok got affected by the poisonous gas and shouted for help. On hearing that, Ashok’s son Hitesh entered the tank but fell unconscious. When the fatherson duo did not come out Mahesh went inside followed by the three housekeeping staff of the hotel. Patanwadiya, a farmer, who had come only to carry the dirt in his tractor also entered the tank to rescue the six others, but he too fell victim to the poisonous gas. As all seven of them went missing, a couple of boys who had accompanied the workers called the hotel staff who in turn informed the Dabhoi municipality and local police. Since the municipality did not have necessary equipment, they sought help from Vadodara Fire and Emergency Services. “All seven died of suffocation as the pressure of gas was high in the tank,” said Vadodara fire officer Nikunj Azad. The mouth of the tank was so narrow that firemen had to widen it using an earthmover to bring out the bodies. Once the bodies were removed, a suction tank vehicle of Vadodara Municipal Corporation cleaned the tank. “We had sent teams to the hotel owner’s home in Bharuch and native Siddhpur, but he was not found at any of the locations,” said deputy superintendent of police K V Solanki. The practice of manual scavenging that is banned by law, however, continues in Gujarat and has reportedly claimed 180 lives since 1993, claimed social activist Parshottam Vaghela. Earlier this year, five sanitation works have died of suffocation after entering manholes or septic tanks in separate incidents in Ahmedabad. In 1993 Union government had enacted the law prohibiting manual scavenging and in 2013 amended it to The Prohibition of Employment as Manual Scavengers and their Rehabilitation Act- 2013. Between 1993 and 2013 at least 141 manhole workers have died after entering gutter or sewers, as per figures obtained under the RTI Act. Between 2014 and 2019 37 deaths of manhole workers have been reported, added Vaghela. Enraged over the incident Mahindra Group chairman Anand Mahindra twitted, “Enough. Enough of this debasement of human life. I had tweeted about an automated scavenging machine—the Bandicoot—developed by young students & many others have also been designed. What’s preventing their widespread adoption? If funding’s needed to produce in scale, count me in.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AIIMS entrance: Only two from Vadodara i.description: VADODARA: A few students from the city will make it to country’s premium medical science institute, the All India Institute of Medical Sciences, after results of its entrance test for MBBS course were announced late on Wednesday evening. Over 3,000 students from the city had attempted the online exam on May 25 and May 26 for the 1,294 MBBS seats. Two students – Priya Choksi and Urvish Jain – could find their names among the top 650 students from the country. “I had prepared well for the exam, but did not imagine that I will score so well,” said Choksi, who secured 401st rank. Choksi’s father is a surgeon at SSG Hospital and her mother is a gynecologist. Jain, who secured 604th rank, said, “I am very happy with my results. I studied six to eight hours daily for the test.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No action, only letters float on dumping.description: Vadodara: Acting on a complaint filed by a group of concerned citizens, the National River Conservation Directorate (NRCD) rapped the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) asking its authorities to submit an action taken report on the steps it will take to protect Vishwamitri river’s ecology. But the civic body’s casual approach towards the national body’s directive has left the citizens appalled. Instead of submitting any concrete action taken report or even a futuristic plan it proposes to take, the civic body’s officials have simply forwarded the complaint to other departments. On June 3, the NRCD, a part of the environment ministry had issued directives to the Gujarat government to take steps to protect the ecology of the wetlands and ravines in Vadodara through effective waste management. It had also asked for an action taken report from the principal secretary of forests and environment department, Gandhinagar and also to share the report with the applicants. The activists, led by environment activist Rohit Prajapati, had accused VMC of openly violating the provisions of Construction and Demolition Waste Management Rules, 2016, Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016, directions of the Gujarat Pollution Control Board, Gandhinagar and even the National Green Tribunal’s interim order. In response, VMC’s in-charge engineer of futuristic planning cell simply forwarded the letter to the in-charge engineers of all zones, in-charge engineer of stormwater gutter, drainage project, water supply distribution, bridge project, water supply distribution, as well as in-charge engineer of solid waste management department, the assistant municipal commissioners and also in-charge engineers of chief minister and prime minister housing projects! “VMC’s lackadaisical response is indicative of a flagrant attitude to superficially appease, while the officials’ attitude, including the municipal commissioner’s, portrays insincerity towards the concerns of the citizens,” Prajapati alleged. India-Pak ODI keeps betting-wary city co.description: Vadodara: When the India-Pakistan one-day international (ODI) began on Sunday afternoon, the city’s cricket fans kept their eyes glued onto the TV screens, but betting-wary cops kept their eyes trained on public at places where big screens had been installed to telecast the match. To this effect, detection of crime branch (DCB) too formed various teams to keep an eye on bookies and gamblers betting on the cricket match, especially on cafés, where the match was relayed on big screens. “We made teams that were deployed in different areas before and during the India-Pakistan ODI match. It was a widely followed match, so the chances of betting on such game were also high,” said Jaydeepsinh Jadeja, DCP (crime). “Such places like cafés are favourite joints of bookies for accepting and placing of bets. Also, we traced bookies operating from residential areas too,” a police official said. The city police had busted a betting racket three days ago operating from a rented accommodation and arrested seven men from Mumbai for betting on the Pakistan-Australia World Cup ODI. The police said that it has become tougher to trace bookies as they now use mobile applications for placing bets. The police department had also deployed additional security in communally sensitive areas to prevent untoward incident during the ODI. Foot patrolling was also conducted in areas like Mandvi, Yakutpura and Fatehpura on Sunday evening.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Burglars flee with cash, jewellery from.description: VADODARA: Thieves targeted a builder’s bungalow on Ajwa Road sometime between Tuesday night and Wednesday morning and decamped with cash, gold ornaments and other valuables worth Rs 15 lakh. They broke into the house of Naeem Sheikh at Nawab Villa near Ram Park on Ajwa Road when nobody was present in the house. Police said that although Sheikh had his belongings at the bungalow, he lived with his family at his other house in Yakutpura. On Wednesday morning, the bungalow’s security guard alerted Sheikh about the broken lock on the front door of the bungalow. When Sheikh reached there, he found that valuables from iron cupboards were lying scattered in the bedrooms and the safes inside them were open. Sheikh told police that gold necklaces, earrings, bangles and rings among other jewellery were stolen. Cash amounting to Rs 8.2 lakh belonging to Sheikh and his daughter were also missing. He stated in his complaint that documents of various properties were stolen from the safes. A complaint of burglary was registered at Bapod police station in connection with the incident. Police said that a security guard used to keep a watch, but he learnt about the break-in only in the morning. “Even as the house had valuables the complainant had not installed any CCTV camera or security system, yet we are investigating and are also not ruling out involvement of any insider,” said inspector T G Bamaniya of Bapod police station. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Bank of Baroda branch manager accused in.description: VADODARA: A branch manager of Bank of Baroda (BoB) was denied bail on Tuesday for his alleged involvement in a cheating case wherein he helped a real estate developer to siphon off over Rs 3 crore from the company’s bank account. Harinarayan Meena, who was the manager of BoB’s Karelibaug branch from 2011 to 2014, helped the key accused Sukumar Joshi to allow withdrawal of money on a single signature even as other partner’s signature on cheques was also necessary for withdrawing money. Meena had sought bail from a sessions court here on the grounds that he had no involvement in the case as he was just performing duties as the branch manager yet he had been booked in the case. He also told court that the FIR was registered after over a year since the alleged crime was committed and even during his police custody period, cops did not find any evidence of his involvement. In response to his bail plea, the additional public prosecutor Ramesh Gianchandani argued before the court that Meena was hand-in-glove with the key accused Joshi. “As the branch manager Meena had the authority to clear the cheques after verifying the signatures whenever it came for withdrawals, but he allowed withdrawals even when the cheques had signature of only one partner thus his involvement is evident,” said Gianchandani. The court of additional sessions judge A A Nanavati upheld the arguments and turned down Meena’s plea. The court while rejecting the application observed that it is a case where a protector helps the thief and if he will be allowed bail the public trust on the banking system will not remain. Seven undertrials booked for using mobil.description: VADODARA: Seven undertrials lodged in Vadodara Central Jail were booked after two mobile phones were found from their barrack on Saturday morning. A team of jail sepoys conducted a surprise check in barrack 3 of yard 7 on Saturday morning. While searching the toilet of the barrack, they found a smart phone placed near the window. On questioning the inmates of the barrack, it came to be known that the phone belonged to Shahrukh alias Chechi Vohra. Another phone in a working condition was found under the mattress of Yuvraj Devipujak. When all inmates were questioned sternly, they said Mohsin Makrani, Mukesh Thakor, Saurabh Nepali, Shravansinh Chauhan and Sunil Patil had used Devipujak’s phone for making calls. All seven were booked at Raopura police station. On June 13 too, two mobile phones were found from the jail. One phone was found hidden on top of barrack 16 in yard 12 while another was found in a pit near barrack 4 of yard 7. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cheats dupe man with blank bundle in exc.description: VADODARA: An employee of a stationery shop in Sayajigunj was cheated by two persons when he went to deposit Rs 50,000 cash in a private bank near SSG Hospital on Saturday. Mukesh Patel told Karelibaug police that he was handed blank papers in exchange of his Rs 50,000 bundle of notes. According to the complainant, Mukesh had gone to deposit his employer’s cash in the bank where the two accused, aged around 35 years, approached him. The duo told him that they have to deposit Rs 4 lakh in cash the cash depositing machine (CDM), but as they do not know how to operate the machine they asked him to deposit the cash for them. When Patel agreed, they took him to a CDM near Paradise Complex in Sayajigunj. The accused handed over a bundle wrapped in a cloth to Patel and told him that the amount was Rs 4 lakh. They shared the account details and then asked Patel to give Rs 50,000 cash which he was carrying so that they can deposit it for him. Patel told police that he was convinced as the amount that they had given was higher than what he was carrying so he gave them the cash. After the duo left from there, Patel unwrapped the bundle and realized that he had been cheated as there were only two notes of Rs 2,000 denomination. He then approached his employer, who lodged a complaint with Karelibaug police station. Police said that they have checked CCTV footage and found that it matched Patel’s narration. “We are searching for the two cheaters on basis of their faces,” said a police official. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. He doubled up as mother after wife died.description: VADODARA: She had lost her mother when she was just eight years old. But Kasturi Banerjee has remained a top ranker throughout her life. The Vadodara girl had left her mark at the national level in company secretaries (CS) exam by securing the all-India 11th rank. She gives credit for all her achievements to her father, Biswarup Banerjee. “After we lost our mother, my father faced immense pressure from our extended family to get re-married,” said Kasturi, who last year had registered a hat-trick of sorts by maintaining her position as the city topper in the CS exams of the Institute of Company Secretaries of India. “But he preferred to raise his two daughters as a single parent. He doubled up as mother,” she said. “Thanks to my father I know how to cook and can live independently in a metro like Mumbai to finish my articleship,” said Kasturi, adding that it was her father who helped them excel in academics as well as in culinary arts. While Kasturi is finishing her articleship, her elder sister Kuheli, who worked at Homi Bhabha Cancer Institute in New Delhi after earning a master’s in biochemistry from MS University, is pursuing a PhD programme in Germany. Their mother died of jaundice at the age of 38. Kuheli was 13 years old then. “My only aim was to make my daughters self-sufficient. I did not know how to cook, I learnt that and now I can claim to be a good cook,” said Banerjee, 60. “From the beginning, I wanted my daughters to be independent so that whether they get married or not, they don’t have to be dependent on anyone,” he said. He moved to Vadodara from Surat for his daughters who were studying at MSU. Banerjee is happy he has two daughters. “If I had a son, it would have been difficult to keep a watch on him and his movements, especially when you are a single parent,” he said. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Gujarat disposes record no. of decade-ol.description: VADODARA: If courts in Gujarat continue to dispose of piled up cases at current rate, chances are that there will be no old case pending in next three years. Gujarat has earned the distinction of disposing of maximum number of cases pending for the past 10 years. According to the data of National Judicial Data Grid (NJDG), the lower courts in the state together disposed of 3,68,762 cases between 2015 to 2018. In the same period, All subordinate courts across the country had disposed over 12 lakh such cases during the same period. Uttar Pradesh was the second fastest in speedy disposal by clearing 2,68,465 cases. In fact, the disposal rate of cases in the state has been consistently high for the last four years. High court officials said that the high rate of disposal of old cases is mainly due to different initiatives taken. Regular meetings and monitoring of judicial officers at district level helped in bringing down the pendency rate of more than a decade-old cases. At district levels too meetings are held with lawyers to impart training and sensitization so that the old cases are not dragged for long. “The national lok adalats also help a lot in disposing the old cases,” an official said. In fact, in April this year the Union law and justice ministry had lauded the state for high disposal rate of cases which are older than 10 years. A joint secretary of the ministry had written a letter of appreciation to the registrar of Gujarat high court as four district courts had ranked among the top 10 subordinate courts in the country that had disposed such cases in March. The high court registry had sent several suggestions to the ministry so that other states can too increase the disposal rate of such cases. As of now, the cases which are pending for over 10 years stand at 2,19,553, which is lower than Uttar Pradesh – 9,63,538 – Bihar (3,98,118), West Bengal (2,94,858) among other states. According to the NJGD figures, the pendency of old cases in Gujarat is mostly waiting for presence of important witnesses or due to stay by a district court or high court. Another reason is also because of heavy pendency in court due to which time cannot be given to certain cases. Last year, courts in Ahmedabad district had disposed of maximum number of cases – 28,679 – in the state, followed by 21,786 cases of Vadodara district, 8,319 cases of Surat district, 6,242 cases of Rajkot and 5,873 cases of Jamnagar. Fake call centre conning US Asians buste.description: VADODARA: City police’s prevention of crime branch, busted a fake call centre in Danteshwar locality of Makarpura on Friday night and arrested its two operators, Vineet Rawal and Shailesh Yadav. The duo, booked for cheating and violating IT Act, was running the centre for over a year duping South Asians living in the US. During interrogation , cops were shocked to learn it was only the tip of an iceberg. Police said the duo was part of the larger nexus of cheaters operating across the state under a Delhi-based man, Merchant Jordan. The duo told police that they get contact details of persons living in the US and those who have taken loans of amounts ranging between US$100 and 200. The details are provided by the US counterparts of the extensive con network. Rawal and Yadav then contact these borrowers through US mobile phone numbers identifying themselves as executives of the company from which they have borrowed money. “They threaten victims who delay repaying their loans saying that their employers will be informed of their defaulter status which will cost them their jobs,” said in-charge inspector R C Kanamiya of PCB. When the scared victims agree to repay the loan, the duo asks them to repay by buying a Google play card of the value of their loan. They then take the card’s code and share it with Jordan through WhatsApp,” he added. Jordan then shares the code with Chinese links who transfer cryptocurrency to Jordan after deducting their commission. Jordan then converts it into Indian money and transfers Rawal and Yadav’s share, said police. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Power supply disrupted in 560 villages i.description: VADODARA: Power supply has been disrupted in nearly 560 villages of Gujarat due to cyclone Vayu and all efforts are on to restore it, an official said Thursday. The Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited (GUVNL) chalked out an action plan well in advance in view of the cyclone threat, the state government-promoted company's in-charge managing director Shahmeena Husain said. "Around 561 feeder lines in Saurashtra and south Gujarat are affected due to the impact of cyclone Vayu. We are confident that the power supply will be restored soon in the 560 affected villages," she said. The GUVNL teams were finding it difficult to reach some of the water-logged coastal areas, she added. Meanwhile, All India Fishermen Association president Veljibhai Masani president appreciated the state government for issuing a timely warning to fishermen against venturing into the sea. "Around 8,000 fishermen from Saurashtra region were earlier planning to venture into the sea in about 1,200 boats, but they decided against it after the warning," he said. Health services hit as 3,000 doctors joi.description: VADODARA: Health services got severely affected in the city on Monday as nearly 3,000 doctors including private practitioners and those working in corporate as well as government hospitals joined the 24 hours strike call given by the Indian Medical Association (IMA). IMA had given the strike call to protest against attack on their colleagues in West Bengal and stressed for a central law that can make way for stringent action against those involved in violence against healthcare workers. Beginning 5 am, resident doctors and interns at the state-run SSG Hospital had stopped entry and registration of new patients at Central Gujarat’s biggest hospital. Emergency services however were not affected during the day. Later in the day, around 1,000 medical students of Baroda Medical College, GMERS Gotri, Sumandeep Vidyapeeth joined a massive rally that had started from the hospital and ended at Kamatibaug. The strike caused lot of inconvenience to patients who remained dependent on the public hospital for their treatment. “My father-in-law is a cancer patient. He was undergoing treatment at the hospital since last week. But his condition deteriorated on Saturday night. On Sunday, all the departments were closed and on Monday, we were told that he will not be attended because of the strike,” said Rani Manek, daughter-in-law of Lekharam Manek, 60, a patient from Nagwa village of Madhya Pradesh. As news of Manek not being attended by agitating doctors spread, doctors at the hospital intervened. Hukamchand Patel, a 55-year-old patient from Timbikala village of MP, had reached the city on Sunday afternoon complaining of liver related ailments. “We are hoping that doctors will attend him soon,” said his brother Komalsinh Patel. IMA Vadodara chapter office-bearers earlier in the day held a meeting at Kamatibaug garden to discuss the fall-out of the strike call and future course of action. “We don’t want to cause inconvenience to any patient. But, if medical practitioners continue facing such attacks, the entire system will collapse,” said Dr Yatish Shah, president of IMA Vadodara. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Mumbai gang arrested for cricket betting.description: VADODARA: The prevention of crime branch (PCB) busted a cricket betting racket on Wednesday night and arrested seven persons from Sama-Savli area of the city. The accused including an MBA graduate, who is the kingpin of the racket, and a chartered accountant. The police said that it is yet to arrest some more accused in the case. “We had received a tip-off that some people were running accepting and placing bets on the ongoing cricket world cup from a house on Sama-Savli Road. We raided the spot and found seven men in the house. They were watching the cricket Australia-Pakistan match and accepting bets,” said Jaydeepsinh Jadeja, DCP (crime). “Mehul Jain, who is the prime accused, is a big time bookie in Mumbai. He has been running betting racket from Mumbai for last three years along with his gang that includes 23-year-old Aman Sharma who is a chartered accountant,” Jadeja told TOI. The gang was wary of the Mumbai police and hence it decided to shift its base to Vadodara for the world cup. Mehul’s father has a factory in the city and he had worked there for about three years. He was well conversed with the city areas and also knew people here. So he decided to shift to the city with his gang and took a flat on rent in Alkapuri. The gang then shifted to a house on Sama-Savli Road. “They had planned to shift to Surat in next two days. They kept changing their location to avoid any suspicion and arrests,” Jadeja added. The gang used to accept bets from residents of Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Godhra, Surat and Mumbai. The cops have seized 15 mobile phones, a television set, two laptops and a BMW. The police said that the gang used to earn big money from the betting racket. “We are now looking for a the man who gave his house on rent to the accused,” the police said. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tractor taken for carrying waste returne.description: DABHOI: Mahesh Patanwadiya was asked to tag along as he owned a tractor, which was to be used for carrying the septic tank waste. But after their bodies were brought out by firemen, Mahesh’s tractor carried the bodies back to the village. The entire population of around 3,000 in Thuvavi village were left grief stricken. “Patanwadiya was not going to clean the tank, but after the other three people from the village did not respond to his calls, he went inside to check,” said his neighbour Mukesh Rathwa. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nadiad man held for blackmailing married.description: VADODARA: The detection of crime branch (DCB) has arrested a Nadiad resident for allegedly threatening and blackmailing a married woman. Nikunj Soni (30) was nabbed by the cops after the woman, a resident of Karelibaug, filed a complaint against him. The complainant told the police that she had met Soni on Facebook six months back. “The woman and Soni developed friendship and soon they began chatting on Whatsapp. Soni even visited her home few times. After a few days, Soni began threatening her that he will make their chats public and send them to her husband. In March 2019, Soni forcefully took power of attorney from her,” the police said. In May, Soni approached the woman’s mother and threatened both of them. He threatened that he would kidnap her son if she doesn’t pay up Rs 10 lakh. The complainant’s mother then paid up Rs seven lakh. But Soni again approached her mother and took another Rs five lakh. The accused even took five blank cheques that had signatures of the complainant. “Soni forcefully took away the complainant’s mother’s ornaments. He then threatened the complainant that he will use the power of attorney and ensure that she loses her house,” said Jaydeepsinh Jadeja, DCP (crime). When the complainant blocked his number, Soni called up her husband and began threatening him as well. The police have recovered a car worth Rs five lakh from the accused. “The accused was jobless. It seems he used to cheat women with same modus operandi,” the police said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Speed demons to be reined in.description: VADODARA: Before you step on the gas, Barodians be warned. Now, your speed thrill may grill your pockets too. For, traffic police in the city are conducting demo of the speed guns they have been given by the state government to curb speed menace on the roads, particularly on the highway. “The demos we did have been successful. Most of the accidents happen due to over-speeding and reckless driving. The speed gun, which can detect from a distance of 70 metres, will help us crackdown on the rash drivers and bring down the number of accidents. We will penalize those crossing the speed limits,” said Amita Vanani, ACP (traffic). She added that many roads in the city have designated speed limits according to the size of the vehicle and the police even issues notification for it. “We are planning a demo at Akota-Dandia Bazaar Road on Saturday that sees lot of over-speeding. We will place the speed-gun near the bridge which will help detect vehicles crossing the speed limit and also click photographs of errant drivers. One picture will be of the license plate and another of the person riding or driving the vehicle,” Vanani told TOI, explaining that the gun, equipped with a camera, is attached to a printer. By the time the driver reaches Dandia Bazaar Crossroads, a challan will be automatically generated with the photographs. The driver will be asked to pay the penalty on the spot by a police team that will focus only on this drive, she said. After some tests, cops will start using the speed-gun in different areas including Chhani to Nizampura, Akota Road to Jetalpur Road, Karelibaug to VIP Road, Gendigate to Makarpura Road, Champaner Gate to Harni Crossroads and Old Padra Road to Akshar Chowk. SOG seizes country-made pistol, arrests.description: VADODARA: The special operations group (SOG) has arrested a man with a pistol and five live cartridges from the city on Sunday. Mitesh Tadvi, a resident of Kishanwadi, was arrested after cops received information about him having the firearm. According to the police, Tadvi said that the country-made pistol, worth Rs 12,000, and the cartridges at his home belonged to his late father who had purchased it a few years ago. Tadvi’s father had died last year. SOG sleuths said that they are questioning Tadvi to ascertain if he was speaking the truth or had made plans of using it for some crime. Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

VMC chucks PPP, will take up Gotri proje.description: VADODARA: With the slum redevelopment and rehabilitation project at Gotri making no headway due to land acquisition issues, Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) is now looking to take up the project on its own instead of the earlier public-private partnership mode. The project was earlier planned under the Pradhan Mantri Aavas Yojana (PMAY) and work order was also issued for it. The VMC had planned to take up work on four different plots in Gotri by razing 349 dwellings there. These were clubbed together under a single project that was to be taken up as a PPP project under PMAY. Manav Infrastructure Pvt Ltd was identified as the developer for the project after a tendering process. The developer was to construct 349 houses for rehabilitation of slums along with 149 other houses for the urban poor besides seven shops. As a premium towards the project, the developer was to make an additional 199 houses at the site. Of the 345 slum dwellings, 304 were razed by the civic body even as residents of 45 others were granted a stay when they approached court against the eviction drive. The developer had been paying Rs 2,000 to 304 households as rent after their dwellings were razed in August and September 2017. The developer was to begin work on the scheme after completion of the eviction drive and complete it within two years. The project, however, hit a roadblock after the district collectorate expressed its inability to give parts of government land for the project as it was reserved for other purposes. Of the 17,544 square metre land that was expected for the project, the VMC was left with only 11,477 square metre land. Of the four plots that were identified for the project, three were government plots while only one was of the civic body. The developer has now expressed inability to take up the project and has also stopped paying rent to the 304 beneficiaries since November 2018 as the land acquisition was making no headway. He has also sought a refund of Rs 65.31 lakh paid towards rent to the beneficiaries with an interest of 24 per cent. VMC is now looking to take up the project under the Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP) mode under PMAY instead of the PPP mode. The VMC has estimated that it will be able to generate a revenue of Rs 26.28 crore by the sale of these houses and through contribution of government towards the houses. Against this it will spend around Rs 30.06 crore on the project. However, it will also be able to sell whatever it is allocated from the government land earlier earmarked for the project and generate more revenue. Mishap prevented after fire breaks out i.description: VADODARA: A huge mishap was deterred on Tuesday midnight when a fire broke out in a godown of a paint company on Padamla-Ranoli Road near the city. The fire broke out due to overheating of air-conditioner in the office attached to the godown. According to fire officials, the fire spread across the room through electric wires and other appliances also caught fire. There was a room in the office area where the servers and other equipment were placed so the air-conditioner was kept on. Fire officials said that the flames had engulfed the entire office and it further spread to the godown where drums of paint were stocked. The company officials had initially sought help from Nandesari GIDC fire and fire teams of local industries, but as it took a major form, Vadodara Fire and Emergency Services (VFES) was roped in. “By the time we reached, around 200 kilograms of stock had already caught fire so along with dousing fire we also had to move the remaining stock,” said Om Jadeja, fire officer, Chhani fire station. He added that one team was involved in moving the paint drums while the other team was controlling the fire using foam liquid. Fire fighters took around two hours to completely douse the fire. Jadeja said that the company did not have fire-fighting systems despite storing stock in a huge amount. “There was no earth leakage circuit breaker which could have prevented of overheating of air-conditioner so we have asked the local authorities to send a notice to them,” he added. The company is located outside the area of Vadodara Municipal Corporation. During the summer days, fire department received several calls related to overheating of air-conditioners resulting in short-circuit or blasts. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

VMC will replace filter media at Nimeta.description: Vadodara: After it received flak for supplying turbid and yellow-coloured water to the city from its plant, the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) will finally change filter beds of all the three water treatment plants at its Nimeta facility, which remained unchanged for years. The Nimeta filtration facility receives water from the Ajwa reservoir, which it filters and supplies to around five lakh population in the eastern and southern parts of the city. Sources said that the decision to change the filter medium was taken after precipitates were still being found in the water supplied in the city. Also, there was sand loss in the filter medium which has not been replaced for years. The VMC has issued tenders to replace the medium and has also identified a contractor for the work. The civic body will be spending Rs 54.72 lakh on changing the medium which it had earlier only cleaned. It has fixed a deadline of 90 days for the contractor to replace the filter medium. The civic body has also decided to rope in a contractor who will be responsible for maintenance of its Khanpur filtration facility operation and maintenance of the Nimeta facility for three months. The decision was taken after the earlier contractor, Pooja Construction, was sacked in wake of the supply of turbid water in the city. In the meantime, VMC will issue tenders to identify a new contractor to take care of its Nimeta plants. Box: Water supply to be affected on Sunday Water supply to the eastern and southern parts of the city will be affected on Sunday as the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) will take up work to connect the facility using a floating pontoon in the Ajwa reservoir to draw water from its dead storage. The facility will draw water using submersible centrifugal pumps. This would ensure that the civic body draws 18 to 36 MLD water from the reservoir. The water will be released into the Nimeta water plant using existing infrastructure and from there it will be supplied to the city. The civic body will be spending Rs 5.78 crore on the project. While the pumping facility is ready, work to connect its pipeline to Nimeta filtration facility will be taken up on Sunday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Agencies fined for violating terms of ag.description: VADODARA: The civic body on Monday fined a door-to-door garbage collection agency and a trust handling e-toilets at Kalali for violating terms of agreement. Swachhata Corporation, an agency handling door-to-door garbage collection, was fined of Rs 1 lakh on Monday when it was found that operators of one of its van had dumped garbage in public. The van had dumped the garbage on the morning of June 14 near Nizampura Atithigruh. Officials of Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) said that the agency’s move was captured under CCTV surveillance. In another incident, a trust that had signed agreement with VMC’s futuristic planning cell to install an e-toilet in Kalali was ordered to pay administrative charges of Rs 40,300. After installing the e-toilet the trust joined the water line with the main line of the civic body without applying for water connection. When the civic officials learnt about a leakage in its own line, it came to light that the trust had joined a pipe illegally. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lessons that die inside Vadodara\u2019s.description: VADODARA: Friday midnight’s incident in which seven persons died inside a septic tank at Hotel Darshan at Thuvavi village of Dabhoi taluka is a bitter reminder of similar incidents that have taken place in the past in the city. Three sanitation workers had died at the Nakshatra Party Plot in Harni area of the city on December 2, 2016. Much like the Thuvavi incident, the workers had been called to the party plot to clean a septic tank there. The workers entered the tank without any safety gear and died of suffocation from the obnoxious gases inside the tank. The deceased included a Vadodara Municipal Corporation worker Ramesh Solanki and two other labours Rahul Solanki and Pradeep Solanki. They were roped in by a contractor Shakti Kahar, who along with the party plot’s manager Dhaval Kadam, were named as accused in the case registered in the incident. The trial of the case is being heard by a Vadodara court. Prior to this, two other workers had died while working inside the sewage pumping station at Kalagahoda on May 26, 2008. On April 25, 2005, four other workers had died while cleaning a manhole near the Deep Multiplex in the Navayard area of the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Vadodara civic body opposition expresses.description: VADODARA: The Vadodara municipal corporation (VMC) opposition has asked the civic body to ensure that the strength of sanitation workers in the city is maintained during the monsoon. Opposition leader Chandrakant Shrivastava said that many of them fell ill due to unhealthy living conditions during monsoon and remained absent. Shrivastava said that arrangements should be made for replacement of sick sanitary workers by roping in those on daily wages. He said that this would ensure that work was not affected during monsoon. Shrivastava added that the street lights in several peripheral areas of the city and slums gave very low illumination. He said that as a part of monsoon preparedness, these areas should be illuminated in a better way. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gir National Park to remain shut for fou.description: VADODARA: The Gir National Park, which is home to over 520 Asiatic lions, will remain shut for tourists, both domestic and foreigners, from June 16 to October 15, an official said Saturday. The park is closed during this period every year as it is the breeding season for many animals, including the big cats, said Rajiv Gupta, Additional Chief Secretary of Environment and Forest Department of Gujarat government. "Four months of monsoon are considered the best season for the breeding," he said. The Gir sanctuary, located at Sasan in Junagadh district, is the only home for the Asiatic lions and attracts a large number of tourists from India and abroad. "During the monsoon, the condition of roads inside the forest area also deteriorates and it becomes unsafe for visitors to travel on such roads," he said. Besides, the forest department also undertakes maintenance work of the national park in September as peak tourist season starts from November and continues till March end, the official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vadodara: Spending just Rs 3,300 could h.description: VADODARA: Merely Rs 3,300 could have saved the lives of seven people, who died after inhaling the toxic fumes in the septic tank of the restaurant in Dabhoi. Had the hotel owner Hassab Abbas Bhoraniya approached Dabhoi municipality to avail its suction tank facility, none of victims, all residents of Thuvavi village, would have had to enter the septic tank to clean it. Dabhoi municipality lets it suction tank vehicle for private use for a nominal cost whenever a formal request is put up. But Bhoraniya, instead of approaching the sanitation department of the municipality, decided to call in Ashok Harijan, his son Hitesh, Mahesh Harijan and Mahesh Patanwadiya. Ashok, Hitesh, Mahesh, Patanwadiya and three others were suffocated to death when they entered the tank for cleaning. “We let our vehicle to private persons for cleaning septic tanks depending on the availability. We levy a fixed charge of Rs 550 if the vehicle is to be sent outside the jurisdiction of the municipality and Rs 10 for every km travelled. There is a charge of Rs 250 for every time the vehicle’s tank is filled and emptied,” said a municipality officer. As the restaurant’s septic tank is 12 to 15 foot deep, the suction tank vehicle would have to be filled and emptied at least 10 to 12 times. This means, the owner would have had to spend around Rs 3,300 to Rs 3,500 for the work. The hotel owner saved only Rs 1,300 to Rs 1,500 as the four workers were promised Rs 500 each for cleaning the tank. While the official said that they let out the suction vehicle for private use, but it takes several days and many requests before the vehicle is sent. “We have only two such vehicles and our own drainage lines are often choked, so we send the vehicle only if it’s available. However, in this case, we did not receive any application or request from the hotel owner,” the sanitation department official said. On Saturday, the hotel staff had told TOI that it was for the first time that workers were called in to clean the tank manually. “There is a pump to clean the septic tank but because a pipe had choked, it was decided to get it cleaned manually,” said one hotel employee who is working there for the past eight months. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12.
